intro: Boebera pubescens, commonly known as the hairy boebera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Boebera pubescens produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage.
